data.title: Upcoming Films & Events: Indiana University Cinema: Indiana University Bloomington
data.meta_description: Find upcoming films and events at Indiana University Cinema.
data.text:
Thursday, August 22

This screening includes IU Cinema Open House

3:30 pm

Discover all that your neighborhood movie theater has to offer at the IU Cinema Open House with swag, treats, games, and more!

Series:

Additional Films and Guests

Friday, August 23

This screening includes Mad Max: Fury Road

7 pm

The exhilarating, award-winning, post-apocalyptic enviro-action film is back on the big screen AND IN 3D! What a lovely day.

Rating:

R R

Year released:

2015

Series:

Additional Films and Guests

Tuesday, August 27

This screening includes Volunteer Callout Meeting

4 pm

Learn about volunteering for IU Cinema, where you'll meet great friends and watch free movies! What more could you ask for?

Series:

Additional Films and Guests

Friday, August 30

Producer Scheduled to Appear

This screening includes Batman

7 pm

Celebrate the 35th anniversary of Batman, the film that kickstarted one of the most successful and acclaimed franchises to date. Q&A with producer Michael Uslan to follow!

Rating:

PG13 PG-13

Year released:

1989

Series:

Additional Films and Guests, New Americas Cinema

Tuesday, September 3

This screening includes Dumb Money

7 pm

A crowd-pleasing dramatization of real-life stock hijinks featuring Paul Dano, Pete Davidson, Nick Offerman, America Ferrera, Seth Rogen, and more in its stacked cast. Q&A to follow.

Rating:

R R

Year released:

2023

Series:

Healthy Investing in the Age of Crypto, Meme Stocks, and Financial Crises

Thursday, September 5

This screening includes The Spy Who Came in from the Cold

7 pm

John le Carré's precise and ruthless Cold War thriller adapted into one of the most compelling and hard-edged spy epics there is.

Year released:

1965

Series:

Michael A. McRobbie's Choice

Friday, September 6

This screening includes Love Lies Bleeding

7 pm

Lust, love, and violence form a perfect concentric circle in this gripping neo-noir from Rose Glass, with searing turns by Kristen Stewart and Ed Harris and a knockout debut by newcomer (and IU alumna!) Katy O'Brian.

Rating:

R R

Year released:

2024

Series:

New Americas Cinema

Saturday, September 7

This screening includes His Girl Friday

4 pm

All bets are off in Howard Hawks’ wily, laugh-out-loud romantic comedy as newspaper editor Cary Grant creates all sorts of chaos to entice his star reporter and ex-wife Rosalind Russell back into his life.

Year released:

1940

Series:

Saturday Matinee Classics

Saturday, September 7

This screening includes Love Lies Bleeding

7 pm

Lust, love, and violence form a perfect concentric circle in this gripping neo-noir from Rose Glass, with searing turns by Kristen Stewart and Ed Harris and a knockout debut by newcomer (and IU alumna!) Katy O'Brian.

Rating:

R R

Year released:

2024

Series:

New Americas Cinema

Tuesday, September 10

Filmmaker Scheduled to Appear

This screening includes Runner

7 pm

An award-winning story of human connection told with melancholic lyricism and moodily filmed in Indiana. Q&A with the filmmaker to follow.

Year released:

2022

Series:

Additional Films and Guests, Screen Share

Thursday, September 12

This screening includes The Russia House

7 pm

Intrigue abounds when a British publisher, a mysterious woman, and a manuscript containing nuclear secrets collide in Cold War-era Moscow.

Rating:

R R

Year released:

1990

Series:

Michael A. McRobbie's Choice

Friday, September 13

This screening includes The Eternal Memory/La memoria infinita

7 pm

An uplifting yet heartbreaking love story that balances vibrant individual and collective remembrance with the longevity of an unbreakable human bond. 2024 Academy Award nominee for Best Documentary Feature.

Year released:

2023

Series:

New Americas Cinema

Saturday, September 14

This screening includes To Catch a Thief

4 pm

Transport yourself to Alfred Hitchcock’s French Riviera, where the views are gorgeous, the people look like Cary Grant and Grace Kelly, and the wealthy are targets for a clever jewel thief. Q&A to follow.

Rating:

PG PG

Year released:

1955

Series:

Saturday Matinee Classics

Saturday, September 14

This screening includes The Eternal Memory/La memoria infinita

7 pm

An uplifting yet heartbreaking love story that balances vibrant individual and collective remembrance with the longevity of an unbreakable human bond. 2024 Academy Award nominee for Best Documentary Feature.

Year released:

2023

Series:

New Americas Cinema

Sunday, September 15

This screening includes Driven to Abstraction

1 pm

In this documentary thriller, follow a twisting investigation of the art world's greatest scandal of the 21st century.

Rating:

PG PG

Year released:

2019

Series:

Art and a Movie

Tuesday, September 17

Filmmaker Scheduled to Appear

This screening includes Around the World in 4 Days

7 pm

Go behind the scenes and on the stage of the Lotus World Music & Arts Festival with this endearing snapshot of the Bloomington mainstay. Q&A with the filmmaker to follow.

Year released:

2021

Series:

Additional Films and Guests

Thursday, September 19

This screening includes The Constant Gardener

7 pm

A widower's transcontinental quest to find answers about his wife's death leads him to explosive secrets.

Rating:

R R

Year released:

2005

Series:

Michael A. McRobbie's Choice

Friday, September 20

This screening includes I Saw the TV Glow

7 pm

Blurring even further the faded, wispy lines separating real life and screen life in today's culture, Jane Schoenburn's sophomore feature will practically force you to yearn for an immediate re-watch. Good thing we're screening it twice!

Rating:

PG13 PG-13

Year released:

2024

Series:

New Americas Cinema

Saturday, September 21

This screening includes Charade

4 pm

Often called “the best Hitchcock film Hitchcock never made,” Stanley Donen’s stylish romantic thriller offers unexpected twists, cozy ‘60s aesthetics, and the heaven-sent duo of Cary Grant and Audrey Hepburn. Q&A to follow.

Year released:

1963

Series:

Saturday Matinee Classics

Saturday, September 21

This screening includes I Saw the TV Glow

7 pm

Blurring even further the faded, wispy lines separating real life and screen life in today's culture, Jane Schoenburn's sophomore feature will practically force you to yearn for an immediate re-watch. Good thing we're screening it twice!

Rating:

PG13 PG-13

Year released:

2024

Series:

New Americas Cinema

Tuesday, September 24

Filmmaker Scheduled to Appear

This screening includes The 24th

7 pm

The compelling—and timely—true story of the all-Black 24th Infantry Regiment and the struggles they faced that led to the Houston Riot of 1917. Q&A with filmmaker Kevin Willmott to follow.

Year released:

2020

Series:

Jorgensen Guest Filmmaker Series, Kevin Willmott: By Any Means Necessary!

Thursday, September 26

This screening includes Jorgensen Guest Filmmaker Series Presents Kevin Willmott

4 pm

A conversation with Oscar-winning screenwriter, producer, and director Kevin Willmott.

Series:

Jorgensen Guest Filmmaker Series, Kevin Willmott: By Any Means Necessary!

Thursday, September 26

Special Guest Scheduled to Appear

This screening includes BlacKkKlansman

7 pm

Told with Spike Lee's trademark verve and humor, this surprisingly true story of a Black police officer's undercover operation within the KKK is an outrageous and biting indictment of American racism. Q&A with the film's co-writer Kevin Willmott to follow.

Rating:

R R

Year released:

2018

Series:

Jorgensen Guest Filmmaker Series, Kevin Willmott: By Any Means Necessary!

Friday, September 27

New 4K Restoration

This screening includes Black God, White Devil

7 pm

Steeped in history, myth, religion, and politics, and suffused with the feverish intensity of the blistering desert, this film is one of the Cinema Novo movement's most uncompromising statements on current social issues and the universal problem of mindless fanaticism. 60th anniversary screening.

Year released:

1964

Series:

New Americas Cinema

Friday, September 27

This screening includes Hundreds of Beavers

7:30 pm

Join us at the Buskirk-Chumley Theater for this riotous slapstick epic about the frostbitten battle between one man and the diabolical beavers who stand between him and survival.

Year released:

2024

Series:

Additional Films and Guests

Friday, September 27

This screening includes The Others

10 pm

Supernatural shivers and twisty turns abound in Alejandro Amenábar's stylish and atmospheric Gothic horror.

Rating:

PG13 PG-13

Year released:

2001

Series:

Friday Night Frights

Saturday, September 28

This screening includes Bringing Up Baby

4 pm

Love and lunacy abound as Katharine Hepburn and Cary Grant pratfall their way in and out of shenanigans in Howard Hawks’ beloved screwball comedy.

Year released:

1938

Series:

Saturday Matinee Classics

Saturday, September 28

New 4K Restoration

This screening includes Black God, White Devil

7 pm

Steeped in history, myth, religion, and politics, and suffused with the feverish intensity of the blistering desert, this film is one of the Cinema Novo movement's most uncompromising statements on current social issues and the universal problem of mindless fanaticism. 60th anniversary screening.

Year released:

1964

Series:

New Americas Cinema

Sunday, September 29

New 2K Restoration

This screening includes Pandora's Box/Die Büchse der Pandora

1 pm

Celebrate Silent Movie Day with the incomparable Louise Brooks in her most famous role in G.W. Pabst's classic tale of naiveté, lust, and violence. 95th anniversary screening.

Year released:

1929

Series:

Additional Films and Guests

Monday, September 30

Just Announced

This screening includes Creative Collaborations Meet & Mix

5:30 pm

Join us for this Meet & Mix to discover more about how our Creative Collaborations program works, meet potential programming partners & enjoy tasty hors d’oeuvres at The Vault Pub! Space limited, R.S.V.P. required.

Series:

Additional Films and Guests

Tuesday, October 1

This screening includes The Big Short

7 pm

Three separate but parallel stories are told in this scathingly funny and Oscar-winning explanation of the U.S. mortgage housing crisis of 2007. Q&A to follow.

Rating:

R R

Year released:

2015

Series:

Healthy Investing in the Age of Crypto, Meme Stocks, and Financial Crises

Thursday, October 3

This screening includes Sugarcane

7 pm

Indigenous Peoples' Day screening. An investigation into abuse and missing children at a Native residential school ignites a reckoning on the nearby Sugarcane Reserve.

Rating:

R R

Year released:

2024

Series:

New Americas Cinema, Screen Share

Friday, October 4

This screening includes Sujo

7 pm

Violence surrounds a slain cartel gunman's son during each stage of his life in this compelling and visceral coming-of-age story. Winner of the 2024 Sundance Film Festival World Cinema Dramatic Grand Jury Prize.

Year released:

2024

Series:

New Americas Cinema

Friday, October 4

This screening includes The Brood

10 pm

A singular, nightmarish vision of fractured family relationships that could only come from the mind of master filmmaker David Cronenberg. 45th anniversary screening.

Rating:

R R

Year released:

1979

Series:

Friday Night Frights

Saturday, October 5

This screening includes Children's Film Festival Seattle 2024: Best of the Fest Animation Showcase

4 pm

Embark on an adventure around the world with the Children's Film Festival Seattle's Best of Fest showcase of delightful animated short films from each corner of the globe.

Year released:

2021–23

Series:

CINEkids International Children's Film Series

Saturday, October 5

This screening includes Sujo

7 pm

Violence surrounds a slain cartel gunman's son during each stage of his life in this compelling and visceral coming-of-age story. Winner of the 2024 Sundance Film Festival World Cinema Dramatic Grand Jury Prize.

Year released:

2024

Series:

New Americas Cinema

Sunday, October 6

This screening includes Gladiator

1 pm

Ridley Scott's sword-and-sandal epic serves up riveting action, intense drama, and a star-making turn from Russell Crowe that will leave you plenty entertained.

Rating:

R R

Year released:

2000

Series:

Art and a Movie

Monday, October 7

Special Guest Scheduled to Appear

This screening includes 20 Days in Mariupol

7 pm

Winner of the 2024 Academy Award for Best Documentary Feature Film, 20 Days in Mariupol offers a grueling but vital look at the devastating impact of war. Q&A to follow.

Rating:

PG PG

Year released:

2023

Series:

Additional Films and Guests

Tuesday, October 8

Special Guest Scheduled to Appear

This screening includes Newsreel: A Polyphonic History of 1968

7 pm

A selection of work from the legendary Newsreel collective, a national political network and infrastructure of radical media, revolutionary life, and full-time protest that was embedded in the most insurrectionary trends of its time. Q&A to follow.

Year released:

1968-1970

Series:

Newsreel: A Polyphonic History of 1968

Wednesday, October 9

This screening includes Newsreel: Documenting a Movement and Its Cinema

4 pm

A discussion with filmmakers, scholars, and activists Matt Peterson and Giulia Gabrielli about their work to document, archive, and advance the legacy of the legendary Newsreel collective.

Series:

Newsreel: A Polyphonic History of 1968

Wednesday, October 9

Special Guest Scheduled to Appear

This screening includes In the Mouth of Madness

7 pm

The Weird Studies podcast is back with horror godfather John Carpenter's wild and beloved cult classic of nightmarish (and bloody) literary inspiration. 30th anniversary screening.

Rating:

R R

Year released:

1994

Series:

Friday Night Frights

Thursday, October 10

This screening includes High Fidelity

7 pm

What came first, the music or the misery? That's the question music-obsessed record-store owner Rob Gordon wonders as he excavates his past romances after his latest break-up.

Rating:

R R

Year released:

2000

Series:

Staff Selects

Tuesday, October 15

This screening includes The Lunchbox

7 pm

Warm, affectionate, and sweet, The Lunchbox is a clever crowd-pleaser starring cinematic treasure Irrfan Khan. Q&A to follow.

Rating:

PG PG

Year released:

2013

Series:

More Than Masala

Wednesday, October 16

Special Guest Scheduled to Appear

This screening includes Food, Inc. 2

7 pm

In this sequel to the 2008 Oscar-nominated and Emmy-winning documentary Food, Inc., filmmakers Robert Kenner and Melissa Robledo reunite with investigative authors Michael Pollan and Eric Schlosser to take a fresh look at our vulnerable food system. Q&A to follow.

Year released:

2023

Series:

Additional Films and Guests

Thursday, October 17

This screening includes Mother/Madeo

7 pm

Straddling family drama, horror, and comedy, this Bong Joon-ho stunner boasts a deft grasp of tone and plenty of eerie visuals. 15th anniversary screening.

Rating:

R R

Year released:

2009

Series:

Staff Selects

Friday, October 18

This screening includes L.A. Confidential

7 pm

Curtis Hanson's searing neo-noir tackles police corruption, the dark underbelly of Classic Hollywood, and the fight for the soul of the City of Angels alongside star-making performances from a stellar ensemble cast.

Rating:

R R

Year released:

1997

Series:

L.A. Scams Itself

Friday, October 18

This screening includes Oddity

10 pm

A brutal murder, a nearby asylum, a wooden man, a vengeful medium, and an isolated Irish farmhouse combine in one of the most unexpected—and scariest—horror films of 2024.

Rating:

R R

Year released:

2024

Series:

Friday Night Frights

Saturday, October 19

Live Music Event

This screening includes L'Inferno

7 pm

Indie chamber music group Montopolis returns to IU Cinema with their frighteningly unique score for what has been called cinema's first feature-length horror film, a vividly surreal adaptation of Dante's Inferno.

Year released:

1911

Series:

Underground Film Series

Tuesday, October 22

This screening includes This is Not Financial Advice

7 pm

Glauber Contessoto gambled his life savings on a joke cryptocurrency and became "The Dogecoin Millionaire." While it may look easy to get rich online, it’s even easier to lose it all. Q&A to follow.

Year released:

2023

Series:

Healthy Investing in the Age of Crypto, Meme Stocks, and Financial Crises

Thursday, October 24

This screening includes The Cost of Convenience

7 pm

Every day, billions of people use internet platforms under the false pretense that they are free, but what does it really mean to live a life this "connected?" Join us for this U.S. Media Literacy Week screening to explore and highlight the power of media literacy education and its essential role in education all across the country.

Year released:

2024

Series:

Additional Films and Guests

Friday, October 25

This screening includes The Nice Guys

7 pm

Simply the best "1970s buddy cop-neo-noir-comedy-starring-Ryan Gosling-and-Russell Crowe-that-is-beloved-by-cinephiles-critics-and-the-internet-alike" there is.

Rating:

R R

Year released:

2016

Series:

L.A. Scams Itself

Friday, October 25

This screening includes Train to Busan/Busanhaeng

10 pm

It's a non-stop, high-octane, and totally wild fight for survival for the passengers on a train from Seoul to Busan once a zombie outbreak takes over South Korea.

Year released:

2016

Series:

Friday Night Frights

Saturday, October 26

This screening includes The Fast and the Furious

12 pm

They've got the adrenaline, the wheels, and the extreme need for speed. Relive the unforgettable Dom and Brian meet-cute that changed the streets of the world forever!

Rating:

PG13 PG-13

Year released:

2001

Series:

Blockbuster Futures, For the Family Mega Marathon: Fast, Furious, Full-Throttle

Saturday, October 26

This screening includes 2 Fast 2 Furious

2 pm

The thrill ride that began with The Fast and the Furious takes an explosive new turn in 2 Fast 2 Furious! It's the nitro-fueled answer to the question "How fast do you like it?"

Rating:

PG13 PG-13

Year released:

2003

Series:

Blockbuster Futures, For the Family Mega Marathon: Fast, Furious, Full-Throttle

Saturday, October 26

This screening includes The Fast and the Furious: Tokyo Drift

4 pm

Justin Lin supercharges the Fast films in his first of five directorial stints for the franchise, creating a beloved entry in the series with the introduction of fan-favorite character Han. You drift? You will after this one!

Rating:

PG13 PG-13

Year released:

2006

Series:

Blockbuster Futures, For the Family Mega Marathon: Fast, Furious, Full-Throttle

Saturday, October 26

This screening includes Fast & Furious

6 pm

Reunited and it feels so good! Dom and Brian (and the family!) team up once again to do things in and to cars literally no one else should never, ever, ever try to do at home.

Rating:

PG13 PG-13

Year released:

2009

Series:

Blockbuster Futures, For the Family Mega Marathon: Fast, Furious, Full-Throttle

Saturday, October 26

This screening includes Fast Five

8 pm

The fifth installment of the franchise trades L.A. for Brazil as the Fast films burst through as a staple on the global blockbuster market. Dwayne "The Rock" Johnson joins the party, and the sumbitch brings the law along.

Rating:

PG13 PG-13

Year released:

2011

Series:

Blockbuster Futures, For the Family Mega Marathon: Fast, Furious, Full-Throttle

Sunday, October 27

This screening includes Fast & Furious 6

12 pm

FF6 transforms our favorite street racers into bona fide international superspies, complete with flying cars, intricate fight scenes on moving vehicles, and more buddy-cop banter and bad guys than you can shake a racing flag at.

Rating:

PG13 PG-13

Year released:

2013

Series:

Blockbuster Futures, For the Family Mega Marathon: Fast, Furious, Full-Throttle

Sunday, October 27

This screening includes Furious 7

2:20 pm

Hunted by their biggest baddie bent on revenge yet, Dom and crew fight to keep the family together in an in-your-face assault of awesomeness.

Rating:

PG13 PG-13

Year released:

2015

Series:

Blockbuster Futures, For the Family Mega Marathon: Fast, Furious, Full-Throttle

Sunday, October 27

This screening includes The Fate of the Furious

4:50 pm

Anarchist cyber-baddy Cipher (Charlize Theron) amps up the bad-guy energy and pulls Dom and crew back into globe-trotting criminal chaos, all in the name of, you guessed it, Family.

Rating:

PG13 PG-13

Year released:

2017

Series:

Blockbuster Futures, For the Family Mega Marathon: Fast, Furious, Full-Throttle

Sunday, October 27

This screening includes F9: The Fast Saga

7:20 pm

Ooooh! Back story! No matter how fast you are, no one outruns their past.

Rating:

PG13 PG-13

Year released:

2021

Series:

Blockbuster Futures, For the Family Mega Marathon: Fast, Furious, Full-Throttle

Sunday, October 27

This screening includes Fast X

9:50 pm

Legacy is everything in this penultimate installment of the Fast franchise, which starts at 11 and never lets off the pedal.

Rating:

PG13 PG-13

Year released:

2023

Series:

Blockbuster Futures, For the Family Mega Marathon: Fast, Furious, Full-Throttle

Monday, October 28

Special Guest Scheduled to Appear

This screening includes A Conversation with David Ehrlich

7 pm

Join influential and award-winning film critic David Ehrlich for a frank and wide-ranging conversation on all things blockbusters, including the impact of blockbuster filmmaking on independent film, film criticism, audience culture, moviegoing, and more.

Series:

Blockbuster Futures

Tuesday, October 29

This screening includes The Raid: Redemption/Serbuan maut

7 pm

This acclaimed film brings breathtaking and relentless action to the big screen with expert pacing and editing—it's maximum entertainment that will make you ask, "How'd they do that?!"

Rating:

R R

Year released:

2011

Series:

Blockbuster Futures

Wednesday, October 30

This screening includes Candyman

7 pm

An incisive, visually thrilling approach to the horrors of gentrification and the deep scars of the past combined with the chills that come from the minds of director Nia DaCosta and producer Jordan Peele. Q&A to follow.

Rating:

R R

Year released:

2021

Series:

Friday Night Frights, Blockbuster Futures

Thursday, October 31

This screening includes Found Footage Freakout Double Feature: Late Night with the Devil + The Blair Witch Project

7 pm

It's a Found Footage Freakout Double Feature with one of this year's best new horror films and a classic that helped start it all.

Rating:

R R

Year released:

2024/1999

Series:

Friday Night Frights

Saturday, November 2

This screening includes Tootsie

4 pm

An unemployed actor masquerades as a woman to win a soap-opera role in this classic comedy that was nominated for nine Academy Awards.

Rating:

PG PG

Year released:

1982

Series:

City Lights Film Series

Saturday, November 2

This screening includes Taboo and Transgression

7 pm

Unapologetically sensual, explicit, and controversial, this program features an incendiary short by provocateur Nick Zedd and a long-lost film about forbidden desire and sexuality from Charles Henri Ford.

Year released:

1971/1988

Series:

Underground Film Series

Tuesday, November 5

This screening includes Long Shot

7 pm

When journalist Fred Flarsky reunites with his childhood crush Charlotte Field as she prepares to run for president, Charlotte hires him as her speechwriter and sparks fly in this clever and unexpected rom-com.

Rating:

R R

Year released:

2019

Series:

Additional Films and Guests

Thursday, November 7

This screening includes Death Becomes Her

7 pm

Age—and death—are no match for science, dedication, and concealer in this cult camp classic starring Meryl Streep, Goldie Hawn, and Bruce Willis.

Rating:

PG13 PG-13

Year released:

1992

Series:

Q+

Friday, November 8

This screening includes The Long Goodbye

7 pm

Robert Altman's idiosyncratic film ranks among the smartest and most satisfying Marlowe mysteries, complete with a compelling lead performance from Elliott Gould.

Rating:

R R

Year released:

1973

Series:

L.A. Scams Itself

Tuesday, November 12

This screening includes The Great Indian Kitchen

7 pm

A woman's life is turned upside-down as she struggles to be the submissive wife that her new husband and his family expect her to be. Q&A to follow.

Year released:

2021

Series:

More Than Masala

Thursday, November 14

New 4K Restoration

This screening includes Terminator 2: Judgment Day

7 pm

He said he'd be back! While John Connor may be the future leader of the Resistance, he isn't getting anywhere without his mom Sarah.

Rating:

R R

Year released:

1991

Series:

Sequelibrium

Friday, November 15

This screening includes Inherent Vice

7 pm

Stoner hippie and private detective Doc Sportello gets wrapped up in 1970s Los Angeles’ criminal underworld while investigating the disappearance of a former girlfriend. 10th anniversary screening.

Rating:

R R

Year released:

2014

Series:

L.A. Scams Itself

Friday, November 15

This screening includes Bound

10 pm

One mobster, two secret lovers, and millions of dollars ratchet up the drama in the Wachowskis' stylish, twisty neo-noir.

Rating:

R R

Year released:

1996

Series:

Q+

Saturday, November 16

This screening includes Catechism-ically Flawed

7 pm

A blend of impressionistic camerawork, sumptuous cinematography, and deeply felt examinations of queerness, this program of films by Su Friedrich and Paula Gauthier is an intimate study of sexual expression and repression.

Year released:

1987/1991

Series:

Underground Film Series

Tuesday, November 19

This screening includes Ravening/Aamis

7 pm

A lonely, married woman bonds with a younger man over their shared love of unusual foods, but as their excursions become more adventurous, their relationship takes a dark turn. Q&A to follow.

Year released:

2019

Series:

More Than Masala

Thursday, November 21

This screening includes Grease 2

7 pm

Is Grease 2 the most controversial pick in our sequels series? Yes. Do we have any qualms about it? Absolutely not. Stephanie Zinone is a feminist icon; no questions will be taken at this time.

Rating:

PG PG

Year released:

1982

Series:

Sequelibrium

Friday, November 22

This screening includes The Handmaiden/Ah-ga-ssi

7 pm

Class politics, sex, and power intwine in acclaimed director Park Chan-wook's hyper-stylish psychological thriller.

Year released:

2016

Series:

Q+

Tuesday, December 3

This screening includes My Own Private Idaho

7 pm

A tantalizing glimpse of a talented director and his stars all at the top of their respective games, Gus Van Sant's loose reworking of Henry IV is smart and audacious.

Rating:

R R

Year released:

1991

Series:

Additional Films and Guests, Screen Share

Thursday, December 5

This screening includes Magic Mike XXL

7 pm

Look, Steven Soderbergh started it; we're merely doing the important work of rightly honoring the second chapter of an enduring cinematic legacy.

Rating:

R R

Year released:

2015

Series:

Sequelibrium

Saturday, December 7

This screening includes Paddington 2

4 pm

Be a bear. Do crimes.

Rating:

PG PG

Year released:

2017

Series:

CINEkids International Children's Film Series, Sequelibrium

Sunday, December 8

This screening includes Vanya

1 pm

Andrew Scott stuns in this one-man retelling of Chekhov’s classic black comedy Uncle Vanya.

Year released:

2024

Series:

National Theatre Live

Thursday, December 12

This screening includes The Godfather Part II

7 pm

One of the best films—let alone sequels—of all time, full stop. 50th anniversary screening.

Rating:

R R

Year released:

1974

Series:

Sequelibrium

Friday, December 13

This screening includes Carol

7 pm

An adaptation of Patricia Highsmith's seminal novel The Price of Salt, Carol follows two women from very different backgrounds who find themselves in an unexpected love affair in 1950s New York.

Rating:

R R

Year released:

2015

Series:

Additional Films and Guests

Friday, December 13
